p: State of Missouri
To the Honorable the St Louis Law Commussioners Criminal Court of St. Louis
The petition of George Washington Kirk respectfully represents

That he is a free man of color, domiciled and residing in the state of Ohio, and has been free for the space of sixteen years, having with his father and his family been manumitted in Hamilton County State of Ohio on the 13th day of February AD 1840, by his owner Exum Louis of Hind County in the State of Mississippi, as will appear by a certi- fied copy of the record of manumission from the Superior Court of Cincinnati in the State of Ohio which is filed herewith.

He also filed herewith to prove his identity and that is and has been free, the affidavits of Casey Kirk, his father, of J.S. Engert, R.F. Engert, Henry F. Tector and James Richardson, good and lawful men residing in said City of Cincinnati

Your petitioner represents that he is confined in the common jail of St Louis County by James A Felps the keeper thereof, under authority he is informed of Thumer Maddox former Sher- iff of said County of St Louis who committed him to said jail as a runaway slave and as your petitioner is informed has advertised that he will sell your petitioner as a runaway slave. He has asked and been refused a copy of his commitment
Your petitioner alleges that his imprisonment is illegal in this that your petitioner is a free man and not a slave, and that no person claimes him as owner by right or by law.
The Judge of the Criminal Court is now absent from this County as he is informed
And your petitioners will ever pray &c
George Washington Kirk
By Whittelsey Atty
County of St Louis }
George Washington Kirk being sworn upon his oath says that the facts in the above petition stated are true
Geo his Washinton Kirk
X mark
Sworn to and subscribed before me Aug. 11 1856

Charle C Whittelsey attones for petitioner & also in addition that no other application has been for the relief sought has been made to and refused by any other court or officer superior to this court
Cha C Whittelsey
In re Geo Washington Kirk
Petition for Habeas Corpus
Filed Aug 11th 1856
M
